3: Good morning, Commandant.
Whoa! Those are quite the striking pair of panda eyes! Are you... alright?

4: I got a little carried away cooking

3: Zongs? Oh yes, Duanwu festival is coming up. Did you make these yourself, Commandant? They look pretty tasty.
Are those Zongs you have there? What an armful! Are those for the Constructs?
Ah... that's very thoughtful of you, Commandant, but be sure to ferret out the likes and dislikes of our Constructs, to avoid embarrassment.
Wars have been started over less!
Celica leaves before you could muster a response.

4: What does she mean by that?

3: (A delicate sheen of nervous energy does seem to be in the air today. All around Babylonia, people look at one another with wary and distrustful stares)
Good day. Could those be Zongs you have there? Mind if we open them up for inspection?
Oh, no need to worry. We just wanted to make sure. Oh, and also ask you to vote for us.
Hey! Canvassing is prohibited!
You'll have to come with us!
Uh-oh... it's the Zong Police! Scram!
Stop right there!
There's another! Arrest first, ask questions later!
Commandant, over here!
Thank goodness, Commandant. You almost got caught up in that debacle...
You didn't know? As thanks for our assistance in escorting the Forsaken shipment, the ACA sent Babylonia a batch of assorted Zongs.
Disagreements started to spread from the ideal flavor of Zongs, all the way into other food preferences and the definition of good taste...

4: Is this the 'war' Celica spoke of?

3: Now the two factions are hosting referendums in an attempt to install their flavor as the official Babylonian flavor.
The 'Zong Police' is a temporary constabulary, hastily put together to head off impeding violence between the two factions.
The streets are no longer safe if you're carrying Zongs, Commandant...
Say, those Zongs you have there, Commandant. Are they for us?
You made these, Commandant?
Well... I'm not sure what my likings are, or rather, what 'Lucia's' likings are.
But I'll like it, Commandant, as long as you're making it.
Oh, there you are, Lucia. Good morning, Commandant.
What a coincidence, Liv. The Commandant has a gift for us.
Really? Are those Zongs? I didn't know Commandant knew how to make them.
(Which Zong should I give Liv?)
No problem.
So different from normal desserts... sweet, still fresh. Is this really made out of rice?

2: (Pick a grain of rice from the corner of Liv's mouth)

3: Oh! This is... Thank you, Commandant... this is embarrassing.
Time permitting, could Commandant give me some direction too?
Okay, then... it's a date!
No problem.
Thank you... you really poured your heart into it, Commandant.
Liv's smile always feels somewhat forced.
Suddenly, several Construct Soldiers rush over with whistles in their mouths.
Zong-related dispute detected!
Are you trying to start another war, feeding people Zongs you know they won't like?
Humanity shall remain forever divided by the unbridgeable Zong Schism. It is up to us, the Zong Police, to maintain the fragile peace on Babylonia.
Take them away. It is because of these people that war never changes.
C-Commandant!!!
Alright then... but choose wisely this time.
I think Liv is attempting to make her own Zongs as well, but it doesn't seem to be going so well.
Lee and I have tasted quite a few desserts Liv has whipped up with scraps and leftovers. I thought they were good... but Liv always seemed unsatisfied.
Liv seems pretty happy just to receive Zongs.

2: Now to give away the rest

3: So this is the meaning of festivals, and gifts... So simple, and yet it brings such joy...
The thought that... counts...
Ah, Lee. It's good that you're here.
Zongs? Even Commandant has joined the madding crowd...
No, these are handmade by Commandant, in the spirit of the festival.
I see. But I wish to get one thing straight: no matter who made these Zongs, my critique will be honest and uncompromising.
(Which Zong should I give Lee?)

4: Sticky Rice and Bean Paste (Sweet Zong)

3: (Quietly, Lee finishes the Zong and gives a curt nod)
A decent attempt, I'd say...
Lee looks decently... satisfied? Let's call it that.
Commandant, I'm afraid I have nothing to offer except my apologies.
Suddenly, several Construct Soldiers rush over with whistles in their mouths.
Zong-related dispute detected!
Are you trying to start another war, feeding people Zongs you know they won't like?
Humanity shall remain forever divided by the unbridgeable Zong Schism. It is up to us, the Zong Police, to maintain the fragile peace on Babylonia.
Take them away. It is because of these people that war never changes.
C-Commandant!!!
Alright then... but choose wisely this time.
Right, Lee mentioned that he didn't like sweet things.
So he probably finished all of Liv's desserts to make her happy.
Bianca! And Miss Ayla, too. What are you talking about?
Nothing except that exquisite new body of yours! I'd love to have you model for me sometime.
Um... if I can help.
By the way, what do you know about the ruckus outside?
Truth be told, we were driven here by sheer irritation as well.
Though it is understandable. It is only fair to cajole and revel during a festival. To break them up would be somewhat obtuse on our part.
No matter which side gets their way, it will all be a colorful addition to Babylonia's cultural and historical tapestry. It's fun to watch from a distance.
However, even neutral observers like us have to have standards when it comes to taste.
(Which Zong should I give Ayla?)
White and flawless, like a work of art! And the sweetness and fragrance isn't overpowering at all.
The Commandant has good taste!
Well... objectively speaking, there's nothing wrong with the flavor...
But it does feel a bit... boorish.
Suddenly, several Construct Soldiers rush over with whistles in their mouths.
Zong-related dispute detected!
Are you trying to start another war, feeding people Zongs you know they won't like?
Humanity shall remain forever divided by the unbridgeable Zong Schism. It is up to us, the Zong Police, to maintain the fragile peace on Babylonia.
Take them away. It is because of these people that war never changes.
C-Commandant!!!
Alright then... but choose wisely this time.
In my mind, Miss Ayla probably prefers more aesthetically pleasing things.
(Which Zong should I give Bianca?)
Thank you...
But it is still too sweet for my taste.
Suddenly, several Construct Soldiers rush over with whistles in their mouths.
Zong-related dispute detected!
Are you trying to start another war, feeding people Zongs you know they won't like?
Humanity shall remain forever divided by the unbridgeable Zong Schism. It is up to us, the Zong Police, to maintain the fragile peace on Babylonia.
Take them away. It is because of these people that war never changes.
C-Commandant!!!
Alright then... but choose wisely this time.
In my memories, meats were a valuable commodity, and salt was worth its weight in gold too... I've almost forgotten their taste on my tongue.
It was delicious. Thank you.
I remember Lee saying that his taste was not far off from Bianca's. Perhaps I could use her as a reference.
Both Miss Ayla and Bianca approve of Commandant's cooking. What a pleasant surprise.
Gray Raven Commandant! Grr~
Lucia. Commandant.
Chrome, how come you're with Nanami?
So you're Nanami? The strange Construct that Gray Raven talked about earlier?
Yeppers! Nanami usually goes by Nanami!
So you two don't even know each other's names?
Would Lucia and Commandant like to join us?
Nanami, I understand... but Chrome too...?
Well, I could hardly refuse a lady in need of assistance... but I didn't think it would be to lobby for votes.
Alas, a gentleman honors his promises.
Ooh~ are those Zongs you got there? Are they for us?
That would be telling, and telling's no fun! Guess!
(Which Zong should I give Nanami?)
Sweet... yummy!
But don't get cocky, Commandant. Of the four Sweet Sovereigns, Nanami is but the lowliest!

2: What is this Sweet Sovereign business now...

3: Savory...euch!
Savory is ptooey... and Nanami hates ptooey!

Alright then... but choose wisely this time.
Children usually gravitate towards sweets more... though Nanami hardly counts as one, it's a safe bet.

4: Egg Yolk and Five Spice Pork (Savory Zong)

3: Oh, my thanks, Commandant!
It is not... inedible, but common sense dictates that sweets have no place in a main course. The two should remain separate.
Regrettably, I must draw the line at sweet rice...
Suddenly, several Construct Soldiers rush over with whistles in their mouths.
Zong-related dispute detected!
Are you trying to start another war, feeding people Zongs you know they won't like?

Take them away. It is because of these people that war never changes.
C-Commandant!!!
Alright then... but choose wisely this time.
Oh, my thanks, Commandant!
Ah, I prefer this over its sweeter counterpart.
As I recall, Chrome once turned down one of Liv's dessert when I offered it to him. He probably doesn't have a sweet tooth.
But Nanami, on the other hand, has a huge sweet tooth. Strange, that he's hanging with her...
Chrome, you traitor! You have betrayed the Sweet League!
Traitor...?
As you emerge onto the open area of the Babylonia plaza, you see two groups of people facing off against one another, brandishing banners and signs.
Zongs that are sweet cannot be beat!
'Savor' the better flavor!
Disperse! You are not authorized to gather here.
The Zong Police successfully disperse most of the rabble-rousers, until only the ringleaders of the opposing movements are left.
Did you two have to start a riot...
What was I supposed to do, stop the groundswell of support for savory Zongs? Why don't you ask that clueless ape over there?
I was elected as leader of this movement. I will not let them down!
Why won't you just concede that sweet Zongs should be the official Babylonian flavor?
*Beep—*ing *Beep—* YOU concede!
Kamui and Karen... so you two are the ringleaders?
That's right. I represent the Sweet Zong League. Karen over there, she speaks for the pitiful Savory Zong Party... And please, call me Captain Kamui.
Tch... Lucia, Gray Raven Commandant... this doesn't concern you.
Actually, Commandant wants to give you a few of these Zongs...
Hmph, then give them already.
(Which Zong should I give Karenina?)
You're kidding me... only kids eat sticky sweet stuff like this. Ugh, I can feel my stomach turning just looking at it.
*Beep—*, fine! You're so annoying. I warn you, if this isn't to my taste, I'll yeet the whole thing to outer space.
No problem.
I mean... it's alright... kinda sweet...
What's that s'posed to mean? You saying I don't have a sweet personality to match?
What is this stuff... why is it hot?
So weird... how dare you give me such a weird combination of flavors! Such a... weirdly... enticing...

2: And yet you ate it all

3: Shut up, you!

Such sweetness in a delectable little package. Convenient!
I could eat these all day.

2: You have to unwrap the leaves...

3: Ahahaha, is that so? (nibble) I was just about to say that the leaves are a bit on the tough side! (nibble)

2: Didn't think I'd be this tired
4: Since when did gifting get so hard...

3: Don't worry. Come tomorrow, they'll be back to normal... mostly.
Still, it's a shame that Commandant's Zongs couldn't bring everyone together for the festival...
I usually have a feel for what you're thinking.
Festivals are rare occasions. It would be nice to have all of Babylonia together to celebrate.
So? The Gray Raven Commandant knows his way around a Zong, doesn't he?
Hmph... it's so-so. It's better than you, Kamui, gorging yourself on savory Zongs.
Yep! Those savory Zongs were halfway decent... And that's Captain Kamui to you.
Ahh! Even Captain Kamui has gone rogue!
Savory Zongs ain't half bad!
That's it! Nanami wants to try the other flavors too!
Nobody was keeping you in the first place...
Captain! You're here too?
No, I distinctly recall you crowning yourself Captain, Captain Kamui.
Ahh... I was just horsing around, Captain.
It would seem that this 'war' of ours shall end unresolved.
That's alright. War, in all its forms, is never a good thing.
Festivals like these, it's better to have everyone together.

2: Though we seem to be short on Zongs

3: I actually brought a lot of sweet treats too, Commandant. If you don't mind... we can all share.
It's great when everyone comes together, Commandant. I wish we can spend every year, every month, and every holiday just like this.
I don't know why, but the words just... surfaced in my M.I.N.D.... then leapt off my tongue.
It's good, on a day like this, to have everyone together.
Happy Duanwu festival, Commandant.
And just like that, this war of foolish pride has come to an end.
Hm? Does Celica like Savory or Sweet Zongs?
Well... why not take a guess, Commandant?
